skills: Drafting, Space planning, Interior architectural detailing, Color and material application, Proficient with furniture systems, Concept development, Proficient in AutoCAD, Graphic presentations, Product specifications, 3D, Approach, Art, AGENCY, AutoCAD, Basic, budgets, Color, Concept, Concept development, content, Council, client, clients, direction, documentation, Drafting, fast, floor plans, Graphic, HVAC, Instructor, interior design, Interior Design, Lighting, access, Window, Plumbing, presentations, Design Process, Space planning, specification, Teaching, vision, written
summary: Interior Designer with a distinct understanding of spatial theory who harbors an exceptional design instinct and is uniquely attuned to the importance of materiality, lighting, composition and the overall design process.
work_experience: From August 2011 to present, and previously from October 2005 to September 2011, this individual served as a Principle Designer/Owner, designing floor plans, elevations, 3D views, and material boards, managing projects from schematic design to installation, creating professional presentations, overseeing furniture selection, maintaining specifications, conducting site visits, assisting clients with furnishings, producing content for material boards and binders, and reviewing project costs and schedules. From July 1997 to July 2005, they worked as a CAD Operator/Designer for a New York City MEP firm, focusing on electrical, plumbing, sprinklers, and HVAC, collaborating with engineers, architects, and interior designers. Prior to this, from October 1995 to April 1997, they were a Lighting Designer, responsible for developing and designing overall and specialty lighting for May Company Stores, including floor plans, elevations, presentations, and specifications. They also acted as a Lighting Designer and Project Manager for David A Mintz Inc., where they developed and designed lighting for several large-scale department store projects, meeting all deadlines.
